p: Ten plants were selected as “probes” for this analysis based on a recent study of the SMC where the most frequently cited plants from two regions of Ireland were identified ( Shannon et al., 2018). This number was reduced to seven (see below) and of these, three plants were prioritized. All the “plant” names that are documented in the SMC are in vernacular form, as the pupils did not have any botanical knowledge. As a result, reference tools such as the Irish plant book “Ireland’s Generous Nature” ( Jackson, 2014) and Kew Gardens online checklist www.theplantlist.org were utilized to identify the most probable plant species where possible.
